intro: Stenogyne angustifolia var. meeboldii, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
